metadata.name: Potential Persistence Via Microsoft Office Add-In
metadata.comment: Detects potential persistence activity via startup add-ins that load when Microsoft Office starts (.wll/.xll are simply .dll fit for Word or Excel).

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('3') AND (contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\microsoft\\word\\startup\\')) AND endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.wll')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\microsoft\\excel\\startup\\')) AND endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.xll')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('microsoft\\excel\\xlstart\\')) AND endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.xlam')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\microsoft\\addins\\')) AND (endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.xlam')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.xla')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.ppam')))))

output.summary: Detects potential persistence activity via startup add-ins that load when Microsoft Office starts (.wll/.xll are simply .dll fit for Word or Excel).

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate add-ins References: Internal Research, https://labs.withsecure.com/publications/add-in-opportunities-for-office-persistence, https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/4ae9580a1a8772db87a1b6cdb0d03e5af231e966/atomics/T1137.006/T1137.006.md
